page.title: 01Introduction To Notgrove
page.content: This block in the north Cotswolds is rural, with one main road, the A436 running through it and one village called Notgrove. For the visitor there are Caravan club sites, a long Barrow, and an interesting Church with an unique needlework, as well as a quiet pictoresque village to walk through. In the village there is a thriving cricket club, an annual produce show as well as a social club all using the village hall. The mobile library and other services come to the village. The children have to leave the village for their education. Most employment is on the arable farm. The landscape and wildlife is also of note.
